p: CHK is a fast-onset febrile illness characterized by intense asthenia, arthralgia, myalgia, headache and skin rash. In contrast to other arboviruses, such as dengue, most infected are symptomatic, less than 15% are asymptomatic. Nonspecific signs and less common symptoms include lymphadenopathy, pruritus, and digestive disorders. Severe cases can manifest with encephalopathy and encephalitis, myocarditis, hepatitis and multiple organ failure, these rare forms can be fatal. Its association with neurological sequelae has been increasing [ 12- 13].
